title: Check (The Warning)
coachIntro: The King is under attack! He must run, block, or fight. He cannot ignore this.
summary: Learn the three defenses against check: Capture, Protect, Run (CPR), and when each one is best.

tasks.prompt: Your King is in check from a Rook. You cannot block safely. Move the King to a safe square.
tasks.successMessage: Good. First, you must learn to survive. Run to safety.

tasks.prompt: You are in check from the Queen along the file. A pawn can step in front of the attack. Block the check with the cheapest piece.
tasks.successMessage: Excellent. A simple pawn is enough to stop a royal attack.

tasks.prompt: The attacker is close and unprotected. Use CPR: this time, capture the attacker.
tasks.successMessage: Good. When the attacker is loose and undefended, you cut off the head.

tasks.prompt: You are in check and you have three options: capture, block, or run away. Which defense is the strongest?
tasks.successMessage: Exactly. Capture is best when it is safeâ€”no more attacker, no more problem.

tasks.prompt: Double check! Two pieces are giving check at the same time. Remember: you cannot block both, and you cannot capture them both. There is only one defense.
tasks.successMessage: Yes. In a double check, the King must move. There is no other cure.
